projectElectus

Class GameOver

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • projectElectus.GameOver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GameOver
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.lang.Runnable
    This class creates the Game Over frame when it is created as an object when the Character runs out of health. It also monitors whether the user clicks clicks to go to the Menu and creates a new Menu or the user clicks Exit and it exits.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameOver()
      This constructor creates an object of the GameOver class, sets the size of the frame, adds a Mouse Listener, sets the background color to black, and shows and updates the frame.

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        This method overrides the MouseListener class method to detect when the user clicks the mouse. If the user clicks the menu button, then a new Menu will be created, if the user clicks Exit, then the program will exit.
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
